content:
Hello everyone. lean4-input.el, i.e. the Lean4 input method, is quite complex due to its high customizability. In order to check if it's worth maintaining this complexity, I'd like to make a little survey:

Does anyone customize the Lean4 input method? How do you customize it? Does it make sense to incorporate your customizations into the proper upstream Lean4 input method?
@Yury G. Kudryashov, could you share the shortcuts you add to lean4-input-user-translations? I wonder if they are opinionated or if they'd be commonly appreciated.
Note that additions should go to VSCode, then synced to EMacs (there is a github action for this).
UPD: github action fails, because VSCode moved its abbreviations.json somewhere else.
enat is available upstream, -int is called integral- there, ∂ is \partial.
I'm going to update the URL, then push update to abbreviations
People can have local shortcuts for symbols they use in notation in their projects.
Mekeor Melire has marked this topic as resolved.
